body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/solvable/462653cb84.9f273e321a.L9bYfD.jpg?width=250"}},{"type":"text","text":"
Consider a hypercube of side length 2 in a 2014-dimensional space. Inscribe a unit hypersphere in the hypercube. Inscribe a smaller hypersphere tangent to the unit hypersphere and the sides of the hypercube."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The radius of the smaller sphere can be written as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{a-\sqrt{b}}{c}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are coprime positive integers. Find "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b+c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Based on "},{"type":"text","text":"this problem","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Using Pythagoras' Theorem, the distance from the centre of the unit hypersphere to a vertex of the hypercube is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sqrt{2014}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Filling in one corner of the cube with progressively smaller tangential spheres, we find the sum of diameters to be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle 2 \sum_{n=0}^{\infty} a^{n} = \frac{2}{1-a}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the ratio between adjacent radii."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Equating the former plus a radius 1 and the latter, we can solve for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":":"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{2}{1-a} = \sqrt{2014}+1 \longleftrightarrow a = 1-\frac{2}{\sqrt{2014}+1} = \boxed{\frac{2015-\sqrt{8056}}{2013}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Using this ratio, we can compute the smaller radius since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"R = 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"r = aR = a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"r"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"R"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are the small and big radii respectively."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Generally, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{2}{1-a} = \sqrt{n}+1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" dimensions."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let the radius of an inscribed hypersphere in a hypercube be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"r"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". By repeated Pythagoras' Theorem, the distance between the center of that hypercube to one of the corners is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\underbrace{\sqrt{r^2+r^2+\cdots +r^2}}_{2014\text{ }r^2\text{'s}}=r\sqrt{2014}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Thus, the distance between the center of the hypercube in the problem to the corner is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sqrt{2014}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Call the center of the hypercube "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"O_1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and the corner "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Call the intersection of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"O_1A"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to the hypersphere "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"X"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Note that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"OX=1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" because the hypersphere is a unit hypersphere. Now call the center of the smaller inscribed hypersphere "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"O_2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and its radius "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"r"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Note that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"XO_2=r"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" because the line connecting the centers of any two tangent hyperspheres goes through their tangency point. Also, by the lemma we proved above, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"O_2A=r\sqrt{2014}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"But wait: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"O_1A=\sqrt{2014}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"O_1A=O_1X+XO_2+O_2A=1+r+r\sqrt{2014}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Thus, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sqrt{2014}=1+r+r\sqrt{2014}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Solving the linear system of equations gives "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"r=\boxed{\dfrac{2015-\sqrt{8056}}{2013}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" so our answer is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2015+8056+2013=\boxed{12084}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Consider the same problem on 2-space."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"https://i.imgur.com/evRxg7d.gif"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Here, you'd be solving this: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sqrt{2} = 1 + r + \sqrt{2} r"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"because "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sqrt{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the distance from the corner of the square to the center, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the radius of the circle and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sqrt{2} r"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the distance between the center of the second circle and the corner of the square."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Similar analogy in 2014-space follows where you solve:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sqrt{2014} = 1 + r + \sqrt{2014} r
\\ \implies \boxed{r = \frac{2015-2 \sqrt{2014}}{2013}} "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let us take "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a , l , d , n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" as the first term, last term, common difference and no. of terms of the AP resp."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_{n}=3 \implies a+(n-1)d=3 \implies 4027+(n-1)(-4)=3 \implies 4(n-1)=4024 \implies n-1=1006 \implies n=1007"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So, there are 1007 terms in the AP as 3 is the last term."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now, Sum"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=\frac{n}{2} (a+l) = \frac{1007}{2} (3+4027) = \frac{1007}{2}\times 4030= (1007\times 2015) = \boxed{2029105}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Here, we have the last 3 digits of the sum as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{105}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

now ,  calculate no. of terms by  p = a + ( n-1 )d ,
  here ,  p =3 ,a=4027 , d = (-4)  ,   solving  we get  n=1007 ,
now , sum of series = n [ 2a +(n-1) d]  /2  ,
putting values we get sum =2029105 ,
so , last digits are  105"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Generally:  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(2k)^{2} - (2k - 1)^{2} = 3 + 4(k - 1) = 4k - 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So we can evaluate the last one:  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4(1007) - 1 = 4027"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now, we can sum that with the first one ("},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"), and we get "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4030"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Evaluating it similarly, as above, it is equal to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2015"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  In conclusion, our answer is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4030\cdot503 + 2015 = 2029105"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and so our answer is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed {105}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"First you realize that this is murica, the land of the free and the home of the brave"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Second, you realize 4-1 = 3
16-9 = 7
36-25 = 11 "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"and so on.."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Then using these murican powers, you realize using real eyes that:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This is just (1007) * (3+2012)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Each pair is a^2 - (a-1)^2 = a + a-1"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Series = 2014 + 2013 + 2012 + 2011 + ... + 1 = 2014 * 2015 / 2"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

So the last three digits are 1,0,5 =105"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"According to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" a^2 - b^2 = (a + b)(a - b) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" (2014 + 2013)(2014 - 2013) + (2012 + 2011)(2012 - 2011) + \dots + (2 + 1)(2 - 1) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" = 4027 + 4023 + \dots + 3 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"There are 1007 terms,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So,
 "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" n = 1007 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" a_1 = 4027 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" a_n  = 3 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Using "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" S = \frac {n}{2}(a_1 + a_n) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" S=\frac {1007}{2}(4027 + 3) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" S=2029105 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 2029 \boxed{105} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So, the answer is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 105 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Using the algebraic identity "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a^2-b^2=(a+b)(a-b)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"we can rewrite our expression as "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(2014+2013)(2014-2013)+(2012+2011)(2012-2011)+..........+(2+1)(2-1)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"which is just "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2014+2013+2012+2011+............+3+2+1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".The sum is just"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{2014\cdot 2015}{2}=1007\cdot 2015"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since we only want the last three digits,we look at the final expression "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\text{mod}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1000"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and that gives us 105."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Here we apply the formula a's power 2-b's power 2=(a-b)(a+b)
so 2014 power 2- 2013 power 2=(2014-2013)(2014+2013)
it will become 1*(2014+2013)=2014+2013 "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
finally we found a series:
2014+2013+. . . +2+1 and solve this with the formula n(n+1)/2
so 2014(2014+1)/2=2029105 and last three digits are 105"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"it can be write like this"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(2014 - 2013) (2014 + 2013) + (2012 - 2011)(2012+2011) + ... + (2-1)(2+1)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"it form an aritmethic formula"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Sn = "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{1}{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" n (2a + (n - 1) b )"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Sn = "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{1}{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" 2014 (2 . 1 + (2014-1) 1)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Sn = 1007 "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\times"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" 2015"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Sn = 2029105"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"the last three digits of the alternating sum is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{105}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"*we can rewrite the expression in the following way: *"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(2014^{2} - 2013^{2}) + (2012^{2} - 2011^{2}) + ................+(2^{2} - 1^{2})"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"by applying the formula* "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" a^{2} - b^{2} = (a+b)*(a -b)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" *,the expression becomes: *"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" (2014 - 2013)*(2014 + 2013) + (2012 - 2011)*(2012 + 2011) +................+(2 - 1)*(2 + 1)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"the final expression becomes: *"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 4027 + 4023 +.........+ 3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"this is nothing but an Arithmetic Progression of first term 4027 , nthn^{th}nth term 3 and common difference -4","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"the value of n  can be found out in the following manner*"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 3 = 4027 - ( n -1)* 4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"equating this we get","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" n = 1007"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"sum of 1007 terms S =","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"  \frac{1007}{2}*( 4027 + 3)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" = ...........105"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"so the last three digits of the sum are 1 0 and 5","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

upto 8 answer is 0

we get 0

title: 2014 is somewhat special
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"How many triplets of integers "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" (a, b, c) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are there such that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a^4 + b^4 + c^4 = 2 a^2b^2 + 2 b^2c^2 + 2 c^2a^2 + 2014? "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" a^4 + b^4 + c^4 - 2a^2b^2 - 2b^2c^2 - 2a^2c^2 = 2014 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" (a^2 + b^2)^2 - 4a^2b^2 + c^4 -2c^2(a^2 + b^2) = 2014 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" (a^2 + b^2 -c^2)^2 - 4a^2b^2 = 2014 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" (a^2 + b^2 - c^2 - 2ab)(a^2 + b^2 -c^2 + 2ab) = 2014 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Suppose there are integer solutions."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now, since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 2014 = 2 \times 1007 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", one and only one of the terms must be divisible by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 2 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". But since the terms differ by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 4ab "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", if one term is divisible by 2, the other term MUST be divisble by 2, which leads to a contradiction. Therefore, there exist no integer solutions and the answer is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \boxed{0} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Observation  : The right hand side of the given equation is even. Hence the left hand side must also be even. This gives rise to two cases."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Case 1 : a,b,c are all even. In that case "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a^4+b^4+c^4-2a^2b^2-2b^2c^2-2c^2a^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is divisible by 16, while 2014 is not. Hence this case is not possible."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Case 2: two of a,b,c are odd, the other one is even. Without any loss of generality, assume "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are odd. Then it is easy to verify that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a^2=1\mod(4),b^2=1 \mod (4), c^2=0 \mod(4)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Hence "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a^4+b^4+c^4-2a^2b^2-2b^2c^2-2c^2a^2 \mod(4)=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", while 2014 is not divisible by 4. Hence this case is also not possible."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Thus there does not exist any solution to this diophantine equation. "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\blacksquare"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Suppose there's a solution, because variable are replaceable with their additive inverse, then without the loss of the generality, we may assume that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 0 \leq a \leq b \leq c "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", rearrange the equation and we get "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(c^2-b^2)^2 = 2014 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", which doesn't have integer solution because "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2014 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is not a perfect square. So they are all positive integers."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Because "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1+1+1 \leq  a^4 + b^4 + c^4 \leq 2014 < 7^4 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", we have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 1 \leq a \leq b \leq c \leq 6 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" divides "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\text{RHS} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", if we have all three of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a,b,c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are even numbers, then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 2^4 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" divides "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\text{LHS} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" but doesn't divide "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\text{RHS} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", which is absurd. So the triplets "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(a,b,c)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" must have two odd numbers and one even number. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Noting that one of the variation of Heron's Formula is, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\text{Area } = \frac {1}{4} \sqrt{ 2\left (a^2 b^2+ a^2 c^2+b^2 c^2 \right) - \left (a^4 + b^4 + c^4 \right ) } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If we assume "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a,b,c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are lengths of the triangle (possible degenerate triangle), then the area of the triangle is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \frac {\sqrt{-2014}}{4} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" which is invalid. So they can't be the lengths of a triangle. Thus, we have another constraint "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b<c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So with constraints:  "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 1 \leq a \leq b \leq c \leq 6 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"the triplets "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(a,b,c)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" must have two odd numbers and one even number. "}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b < c "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"there's only a couple of trial and errors we need to carry out to determine whether they satisfy the given equation"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" (1,1,4) \Rightarrow \text{ Invalid Solution} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" (1,1,6) \Rightarrow \text{ Invalid Solution} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" (1,2,5) \Rightarrow \text{ Invalid Solution} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" (1,3,6) \Rightarrow \text{ Invalid Solution} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since we have exhausted all possible scenario, there's no integer solution to the given equation."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

This can be written as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(a+b+c)(c-a-b)(c-a+b)(c+a-b) = 2014 "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(a+b+c)(c-a-b)(c-a+b)(c+a-b) = 2*19*53 "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
So one of the 4 terms is even.
But we see that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(a+b+c)-(c+a+b)) = 2(a+b)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"
and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(c-a+b)-(c+a-b) = 2(a-b)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".
So if one is even the other term must also be even but two terms cannot be even as 2014 contains only one 2 in it's prime factors....Hence no solutions are possible...."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"It doesn't take long to notice that bringing all the terms, except 2014, to the left-hand-side, the expression can be factored as:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(a^2-b^2-c^2)^2=2014"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We make this observation by noting that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(a+b+c)^2 = a^2+b^2+c^2 + 2(ab+bc+ca)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Similarly, if we have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"-2ab,-2bc,-2ca"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" instead, the factorisation simply becomes "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(a-b-c)^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"From this observation, we take the square-roots of both sides and bring "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" over to the right-hand-side:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\implies a^2-b^2 = c^2 \pm \sqrt{2014}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now note that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are both integers hence the L.H.S is always an integer. On the R.H.S, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is always an integer but "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sqrt{2014} \notin \mathbb{Z}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", therefore the R.H.S is never an integer. Hence the number of solutions to this equation is trivially "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{0}."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

For any number "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the sum of the consecutive integers starting with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"-a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and ending with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is always equal to the number of consecutive integers. "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Proof:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The sum of the terms boils down to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+1+a+2=2a+3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", because terms from "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"-a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" get cancelled. Now, the number of terms which cancel out is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2a+1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and then the two terms "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+1, a+2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are added. Thus, the number of terms is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2a+3="}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" the sum of the terms.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

Sorry to creep you out "},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":"@Daniel Liu"}],"attrs":[{"profile":"https://brilliant.org/profile/daniel-608bo6/"}]},{"type":"text","text":" , but I was sitting directly in front of you...
I basically just said, "There's a bunch of numbers that sum to 67, and they have an average. Either there's 1 number, 67 (obviously not), or 67 numbers with an average of 1, which works. HA. I beat you, Swapnil!
(I don't know if that's valid math, but nothing at National countdown is valid anyway.)

title: 2014-philic Cubic

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since we can see that our polynomial has a lot to do with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2014"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", let's let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a=2014"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Our polynomial turns into "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^3-(a+2\sqrt{a})x+2a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hmm... I don't really like those square roots. So instead, let's let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a=\sqrt{2014}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Our polynomial is now "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^3-(a^2+2a)x+2a^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Distributing gives "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^3-a^2x-2ax+2a^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We can partially factor: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x(x^2-a^2)-2a(x-a)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We can factor the difference of squares further: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x(x+a)(x-a)-2a(x-a)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Aha! We have a common "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(x-a)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" term so we can complete the factoring to get: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P(x)=(x-a)(x(x+a)-2a)"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" or "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P(x)=(x-a)(x^2+ax-2a)"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now let's plug "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a=\sqrt{2014}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" back in. We get "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P(x)=(x-\sqrt{2014})(x^2+\sqrt{2014}x-2\sqrt{2014})"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We have one factor already: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x=\sqrt{2014}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". We are left with a quadratic, which we can thankfully solve via the quadratic equation:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x=\dfrac{-\sqrt{2014}\pm \sqrt{2014+8\sqrt{2014}}}{2} "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We can see that when the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\pm"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" sign is negative, the root is negative. When the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\pm"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" sign is positive, the root is also positive, because "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sqrt{2014+8\sqrt{2014}} > \sqrt{2014}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"r_1=\dfrac{-\sqrt{2014}- \sqrt{2014+8\sqrt{2014}}}{2} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This means we want to find "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"r_2r_3=\sqrt{2014}\cdot \left(\dfrac{-\sqrt{2014}+\sqrt{2014+8\sqrt{2014}}}{2} \right)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Distributing, we get "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"r_2r_3=\dfrac{-2014+\sqrt{2014(2014+8\sqrt{2014})}}{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Simplifying: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"r_2r_3=-1007+\sqrt{1007(1007+4\sqrt{2014})}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Distributing the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1007"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" inside the radical: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"r_2r_3=-1007+\sqrt{1014049+4028\sqrt{2014}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This is the form that we want. We can see that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a=-1007"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b=1014049"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c=4028"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d=2014"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore our final answer is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"-1007+1014049+4028+2014\pmod{10000}=\boxed{9084}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
